p: Screening for adulticidal toxicity of the five EOs was conducted against adult M. domestica. Each EO was diluted in acetone to obtain five concentrations; and acetone alone was used as a control. Each dose was given to 30 female flies (3–5 days old). The topical application method [ 29] was performed by applying substances (1 µL/fly) with an autopipette (Sartorius ®, Gottingen, Germany) on the pronotum of CO 2 anesthetized flies. Each experiment was conducted in triplicate, and fly mortality following treatment was checked after 24 h. The lethal dose (LD) was calculated by using Finney’s probit analysis [ 30] for analyzing the mortality response. The three most effective EOs were selected for combining with insecticides.
